title: 94/732/EC: Commission Decision of 11 November 1994 amending Decision 93/402/EEC on the health conditions and veterinary certification required for the importation of fresh meat from certain countries of South America in order to take account of the provinces of Chaco and Formosa (Argentina) and the State of Santa Catarina (Brazil) (Text with EEA relevance)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 11 November 1994 amending Decision 93/402/EEC on the health conditions and veterinary certification required for the importation of fresh meat from certain countries of South America in order to take account of the provinces  of Chaco and Formosa (Argentina) and the State of Santa Catarina (Brazil) (Text with EEA relevance) (94/732/EC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Member States shall authorize, for 45 days following the date of notification of this Decision to Member States, importation from Argentina and Brazil of fresh meat, produced and certified, in accordance with the conditions laid down in  Decision 93/402/EC.
Annex I to Decision 93/402/EEC is replaced by the Annex hereto.
This Decision shall apply from the 30th day following notification thereof to the Member States.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 11 November 1994.
For the Commission
René STEICHEN
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No L 302, 31. 12. 1972, p. 28.
(2) OJ No L 173, 27. 6. 1992, p. 13.
(3) OJ No L 179, 22. 7. 1993, p. 11.
(4) OJ No L 148, 15. 6. 1994, p. 15.
